qas.question: Subjects featured in Ancient Chinese literature include what?

answers.text: philosophy, historiography, military science, agriculture, and poetry

qas.question: What two inventions helped make Chinese literature especially important and portable?

answers.text: modern paper making and woodblock printing

qas.question: What historic period was the foundry for classic Chinese literature in the ancient world?

answers.text: the Hundred Schools of Thought period

qas.question: What classic work of war science originated during this period?
Who wrote The Art Of War?
The early literature of ancient China was primarily focused on psychology, historiography, philosophy, and what other three things?
Japan is the origin of modern paper making and what type of printing?
The Western Zhou Dynasty was present during what years?
Ancient Chinese literature placed little emphasis on historiography, which had detailed what?
What was complied in 388 BCE?

plausible_answers.text: philosophy, historiography, military science, agriculture, and poetry

context: In ancient China, early literature was primarily focused on <a0_0><b10_0>philosophy, historiography, <b5_0>military science, agriculture, and poetry<b10_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>. <b11_0>China<b11_0/>, the origin of <a1_0>modern paper making and <b6_0>woodblock printing<b6_0/><a1_0/>, produced one of the world's first print cultures. Much of Chinese literature originates with <a2_0>the <b15_0>Hundred Schools of Thought<b15_0/> period<a2_0/> that occurred during the <b12_0>Eastern Zhou Dynasty<b12_0/> (<b7_0>769-269 BCE<b7_0/>). The most important of these include the Classics of Confucianism, of Daoism, of Mohism, of Legalism, as well as works of <b16_0>military science<b16_0/> (e.g. <a4_0>Sun Tzu<a4_0/>'s <a3_0>The Art of War<a3_0/>) and <b17_0>Chinese history<b17_0/> (e.g. Sima Qian's Records of the Grand Historian). <b18_0>Ancient Chinese literature<b18_0/> had a heavy emphasis on <b13_0>historiography<b13_0/>, with often very detailed <b8_0>court records.<b8_0/> An exemplary piece of narrative history of ancient China was the <b9_0><b14_0>Zuo Zhuan<b14_0/><b9_0/>, which was compiled no later than <b19_0>389 BCE<b19_0/>, and attributed to the blind 5th century BCE historian Zuo Qiuming.
